name: The Davenport Hotel & Tower

reviews.title: A really "yes" place
reviews.text: Just stayed one night with our dogs but everyone was great. Had a drink with them in the beautiful lobby, and ordered room service to be delivered in the terrace. No hassles...everything you asked for was granted. Even a little doggie walk/place across the street. Highly recommend it!

We've stayed a handful of time at The Davenport and are always delighted at the consistent quality and service and comfort of this grand hotel. It's a pleasure staying at the Davenport and a pleasure knowing that whenever we need to go to Spokane, we'll find this wonderful welcome at this wonderful hotel. Great place to stay !
reviews.title: Quality confirmed

reviews.text: I recently stayed here, having never been to Spokane before. What a charming, beautiful hotel! The staff is absolutely wonderful - from the shuttle that picked us up from the airport (and gave us a brief tour!) to the friendly gentleman in the red coat manning the door. Everyone speaks to you and wishes you a nice stay, asks how you're doing, etc. The hotel itself is just gorgeous and the rooms are nice - very spacious - and that shower! It's huge! Turndown service was a pleasant surprise. Highly recommend staying here if you're in the area! Sadly, I did not get to experience the Tower but heard nothing but good things about it.
reviews.title: Incredible hotel and staff!

reviews.text: I am staying three nights in the tower. It appears fairly new, in contrast to the historic main hotel building across the street. Service has been helpful and friendly. Unfounded the rooms to be large and beds are very comfortable. A walking tour of the historic hotel building is well worth the time. Overall, this is a well maintained property in a great location. This is my first time in Spokane, and the downtown are has plenty of restaurant and shopping options. There are a number of restored older buildings in the neighborhood that really add quality to the downtown core. I look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Love this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As someone who loves cities, going home to visit family in the Spokane area can sometimes be a drag. I have found the Davenport a place that reminds me of home and where the food is quite good and the atmosphere pleasant. I have stayed there quite a few times and always enjoyed my stay and had exceptional service.
reviews.title: If you have to be in Spokane then you want to be here.

reviews.text: This hotel is on its way to earn five stars! This is an old hotel that has been restored. But that does not mean it smells old or you have to put up with antiquated or temperamental fixtures. The hotel as been restored to its days of glory with modern plumbing, wifi, phones, heating and air. You can spend hours wandering through the lobby and the various meeting and ball rooms. The attention to detail in the restoration is first class and complete. The rooms are comfortable, quiet and clean. Every evening the room was attended to and we found wrapped peanut brittle on the bed for a snack. The bathroom took a little getting used to because there are dispensers on the sink for soap and in the shower for shampoo and soap. They are also trying to be environmentally conscious. Also you can visit the store in the hotel and purchase the products you are using in the bathroom as well as the peanut brittle.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in anywhere

reviews.text: The staff is first rate. They are well trained, want to do a good job and are not pretentious. The car valet service is first rate and they recognize you by the second time you ask for you car. There is a span and pool neither of which I had time to utilize but I heard other guest rave over the service in the spa.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay at the Towers

reviews.text: I will definitely staff here on my return.
reviews.title: Best room service meal I have ever had!

reviews.text: I booked a one king size bed room in the Towers. After reading some reviews i was a bit worried but those worried turnout to be unfounded.
reviews.title: If you are in Spokan(e), stay at the Dav

reviews.text: Overall, i found all the staff in both the Towers and Hotel very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.text: This place is one of a kind from the huge comfortable rooms to the wonderful meeting facilities. The beautifully restored history is amazing. Right downtown with shopping and great areas to walk and explore. Put this one at the top of your list.
reviews.title: One of nicest historic hotels in America

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Davenport Tower and we were extremely pleased with our stay and enjoyed it just as much as the first time. The Davenport is a top notch hotel with prices that are very reasonable. The extra touches that are put into the rooms make your stay much nicer. My favorite part of the room was the comfortable bed and extra large walk in shower. We brought our 22 year old son with us on vacation, and he also thoroughly enjoyed the stay. I made a comment to my husband and son that I wished that the Davenport was closer than 4 1/2 hours away because I would stay more often. If you are brought to Spokane for any reason, be sure to book a room at the Davenport and I am sure you will be just as happy as we have been. Also, be sure to pick up some of their soft peanut brittle; it is to die for!
reviews.title: Beautiful Stay!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Davenport as part of a conference. I was pleasantly surprised mostly because I wasn't really sure what to expect going to a smaller town like Spokane. There are two things that I would mention. First, there are two different buildings across the street from each other. One is a historic (but modern and renovated) building, and the other is a newer tower. Just be clear on which hotel you are booking at. I didn't realize this when I was booking and checking-in. I actually thought the historic building was code for old, but it actually was in great condition. It had obviously been modernized at some point, but they still kept the charm of it being a historic building. By having two separate buildings, there are actually lots of amenities between the two, and you have access to all of it. The other, more minor but annoying issue was that their irons are awful. As I said, I was there for a conference, so I wanted to iron my shirts. The iron in the room didn't glide smoothly over the shirts. It stuck to the material and ended up ironing the creases into my shirt, that I couldn't get out. So, I called for a different iron. Another iron was brought to my room. It also had the same issue, but this one oozed this brownish liquid that stained my shirt. I was able to clean it out, but now my shirt was a mess. I called for yet another iron, and this one was at the very limit of sufficient but would likely soon no longer work as it should. So, come with a backup plan if the irons aren't any good in the room. Maybe get them pressed somewhere nearby if you have time or bring a travel steamer to steam the wrinkles out. Still, a very nice hotel with friendly staff.
reviews.title: Nice historic hotel

reviews.text: Stayed just one night while in the area on business. The Jungle "decor" was unique (maybe slightly over the top in some ways) but still nice. the hotel had been done over well and the staff were all quite nice. The rooms (at least mine) still had some older feel as the gold fixtures felt 1990s.
reviews.title: unique decor, a nice place to saty

reviews.text: All in all a good stay in a nice place.
reviews.title: Elegant without being "stuffy"

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Davenport (the original, main hotel, not the Tower) in mid-June 2013 while visiting other family and enjoyed our stay. My wife and I stayed in a penthouse king suite on the 14th floor, and my mother and teenaged daughter and son stayed in a king room on the 10th floor with a sleeper sofa. Given the type of relatively upscale hotel that the Davenport reputedly was, I thought our package, which included valet parking and a substantial daily dining credit, was reasonably priced. Our rooms were clean, reasonably spacious, well-appointed, and comfortable. Everything in the hotel appeared to be well maintained. Good WiFi service, decent TV service. All of the hotel's staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel's main restaurant provided average food and service and was not worth the price for dinner, but the Sunday brunch was good (and popular). My wife and daughter enjoyed the spa, and my son got the best haircut treatment of his life for a very reasonable price there, too. We enjoyed the hotel's proximity to the Riverfront mall and park as well as some other good restaurants we tried (one of the best Italian meals of our lives at The Italian Kitchen, a five-block walk, and good food and excellent service at The Satellite Diner, about a three- or four-block walk). All in all, I would stay there again if I could get a comparable package.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in the tower as all of the rooms in the historic hotel were booked. The safari decor is striking and very surprising in the hotel lobby. Rooms are big, clean and boast most amenities that one would expect. Dinner in the historic Davenport was a delight, absolutely delicious. Service came with a smile, valet, check-in and restaurant staff were very courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: At the tower
Davenport Tower
reviews.text: We recently stayed in the Davenport Tower property while visiting Spokane. Our on-line reservation had been made at the Hotel Lusso - a sister property - but when we checked in to the Lusso we were dismayed to find the hotel quite dated and the fitness room not much more than a closet with three cardio machines in it. We were encouraged to visit the Tower property and much preferred the modern building and amenities there. The staff readily changed our reservation and we had a wonderful stay. The room was clean and quiet, the bed comfortable and we liked the dispense-type shampoo, soap, etc. The staff was friendly and the hotel was centrally located. Starbucks in the lobby made our morning coffee easy to get, parking in the next door structure was $15/day (we chose to self park), the hotel restaurant was good. We will stay there again.

My wife and I had a very good couple of days at the Davenport. The hotel is beautiful and spotless, service was excellent and friendly. Staff was very professional.The rooms were quiet and the bed was comfortable. Loved the large expansive shower! I was pleasantly surprised by the restaurants, especially the safari room in the tower (we stayed at the original Davenport just across the street). They were not cheap, but were not expensive either and the quality of food and service was excellent. Only nitpicks I might have is the parkade is across the street which is a little inconvenient @ $15/day. I would also recommend a north facing room away from the train tracks if you want quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent property, would certainly stay at again

reviews.text: I must admit I was truly surprised that Spokane has a hotel of this caliber. It is easily on par, if not better, than high end hotels like Fairmont properties in my opinion.
reviews.title: So Disappointed!
